cytopy.flow.batch_effects¶

Classes

EvaluateBatchEffects(experiment, …)

Evaluate the batch effects present in an experiment.

Functions

generate_groups(linkage_matrix, sample_ids, …)

Given the output of EvaluateBatchEffects.similarity_matrix (that is the linkage matrix and ordered list of sample IDs) and a desired number of groups, return a Pandas DataFrame of sample IDs and assigned group ID, generated by cutting the linkage matrix in such a way that the desired number of groups are generated.

indexed_kde(named_x, kde_f)

Utility function for mapping KDE function across multiple data-sets; returns tuple (key, PDF) so that the resulting PDFs can be sorted after calculation.

jenson_shannon_dist(x, y)

Wrapper for scipy.spatial.distance.jensenshannon

kl_distance(x, y)

Wrapper for scipy.stats.entropy
class cytopy.flow.batch_effects.EvaluateBatchEffects(experiment: cytopy.data.fcs_experiments.FCSExperiment, root_population: str, samples: list = None, transform: str = 'logicle', scale: str = None, sample_n: str = 10000)¶

Bases: object

Evaluate the batch effects present in an experiment. Contains utility functions for visualising the total variation amongst collected samples.

Parameters

  • experiment (FCSExperiment) – Experiment to evaluate

  • root_population (str) – Root population; population to be retrieved from each sample for comparison

  • samples (list, optional) – List of samples to include in analysis, if None given all samples will be included

  • transform (str, (default='logicle')) – Method used to transform data prior to analysis

  • scale (str, optional) – Optional parameter to scale data prior to analysis

  • sample_n (int, optional, (default=10000)) – Number of events to sample from each file in experiment

Methods

calc_divergence(target_id, comparisons, …)

Calculate the statistical distance between the probability density function of a target sample and one or many comparison samples.

dim_reduction_grid(reference_id, …)

Generate a grid of embeddings using a valid dimensionality reduction technique, in each plot a reference sample is shown in blue and a comparison sample in red.

divergence_barplot(target_id, comparisons, …)

Generate a barplot of statistical distance to some reference sample (target).

load_data()

Load new dataset from given FCS Experiment

marker_variance(reference_id, …)

For a given reference sample and a list of markers of interest, create a grid of KDE plots with the reference sample given in red and comparison samples given in blue.

similarity_matrix(exclude, figsize, …)

Generate a clustered heatmap of pairwise statistical distance comparisons.
calc_divergence(target_id: str, comparisons: list, kde_kernel: str = 'gaussian', divergence_method: str = 'jsd', verbose: bool = False) → numpy.array¶

Calculate the statistical distance between the probability density function of a target sample and one or many comparison samples.

Parameters

  • target_id (str) – sample ID for PDF p

  • comparisons (list) – list of sample IDs that will form PDF q

  • kde_kernel (str, (default='gaussian')) – name of kernel to use for density estimation (default = ‘gaussian’)

  • divergence_method (str, (default='jsd')) – name of statistical distance metric to use; valid choices are: *jsd: squared Jensen-Shannon Divergence (default) *kl: Kullback–Leibler divergence (relative entropy); warning, asymmetrical *hellinger: squared Hellinger distance

  • verbose (bool, (default=False)) – If True, function will return regular feedback (default = False)

Returns

List of tuples in format (SAMPLE_NAME, DIVERGENCE)

Return type

list

dim_reduction_grid(reference_id: str, comparisons: list, features: list, figsize: tuple = (10, 10), method: str = 'PCA', kde: bool = False)¶

Generate a grid of embeddings using a valid dimensionality reduction technique, in each plot a reference sample is shown in blue and a comparison sample in red. The reference sample is conserved across all plots.

reference_id: str

This sample will appear in red as a comparison

comparison_samples: list

List of samples to compare to reference (blue)

features: list

List of features to use for dimensionality reduction

figsize: tuple, (default=(10,10))

Size of figure

method: str, (default=’PCA’)

Method to use for dimensionality reduction (see flow.dim_reduction)

kde: bool, (default=False)

If True, overlay with two-dimensional PDF estimated by KDE

Returns

Plot printed to stdout

Return type

None

divergence_barplot(target_id: str, comparisons: list, figsize: tuple = (8, 8), kde_kernel: str = 'gaussian', divergence_method: str = 'hellinger', verbose: bool = False, **kwargs)¶

Generate a barplot of statistical distance to some reference sample (target).

Parameters

  • target_id (str) – Sample to use as reference

  • comparisons (list) – List of samples to be included in analysis and compared to reference

  • figsize (tuple, (default=(8,8))) – Size of barplot figure

  • kde_kernel (str, (default='gaussian')) – Name of kernel to use for kernel density estimation that generates PDF for statistical distance calculation

  • divergence_method (str, (default='hellinger')) – Name of method to use for statistical distance

  • verbose (bool, (default=False)) – Feedback

  • kwargs – Keyword arguments to pass to Seaborn.barplot

Returns

Return type

None

load_data() → dict¶

Load new dataset from given FCS Experiment

Returns

{sample_id: Pandas.DataFrame}

Return type

dict

marker_variance(reference_id: str, comparison_samples: list, markers: list = None, figsize: tuple = (10, 10))¶

For a given reference sample and a list of markers of interest, create a grid of KDE plots with the reference sample given in red and comparison samples given in blue.

Parameters

  • reference_id (str) – this sample will appear in red on KDE plots

  • markers (list, optional) – list of valid marker names to plot in KDE grid

  • comparison_samples (list) – list of valid sample names in the current experiment

figsize: tuple, (default=(10,10))

size of resulting figure

Returns

Return type

Matplotlib figure

similarity_matrix(exclude: list = None, figsize: tuple = (12, 12), kde_kernel: str = 'gaussian', distance_metric: str = 'jsd', clustering_method: str = 'average', **kwargs)¶

Generate a clustered heatmap of pairwise statistical distance comparisons. This can be used to find samples of high similarity and conversely demonstrates samples that greatly differ. Returns a linkage matrix that can be given to scipy.cluster.hierarchy.cut_tree to subset samples. Also returns Seaborn ClusterGrid instance.

Parameters

  • exclude (list, optional) – list of sample IDs to be omitted from plot

  • figsize (tuple, (default=(12,12)) – size of resulting Seaborn clusterplot figure

  • kde_kernel (str, (default='guassian')) – name of kernel to use for density estimation (default = ‘gaussian’)

  • distance_metric (str, (default='jsd')) – name of statistical distance metric to use; valid choices are: *jsd: squared Jensen-Shannon Divergence (default) *kl: Kullback–Leibler divergence (relative entropy); warning, asymmetrical *hellinger: squared Hellinger Divergence

  • clustering_method (str, (default='average')) – method for hierarchical clustering, see scipy.cluster.hierarchy.linkage for details

  • kwargs – additional keyword arguments to be passed to Seaborn ClusterPlot (seaborn.pydata.org/generated/seaborn.clustermap.html#seaborn.clustermap) (hierarchical clustering encoded as a linkage matrix, array of sample IDs, Seaborn ClusterGrid instance)

cytopy.flow.batch_effects.generate_groups(linkage_matrix: numpy.array, sample_ids: list, n_groups: int)¶

Given the output of EvaluateBatchEffects.similarity_matrix (that is the linkage matrix and ordered list of sample IDs) and a desired number of groups, return a Pandas DataFrame of sample IDs and assigned group ID, generated by cutting the linkage matrix in such a way that the desired number of groups are generated.

Parameters

  • linkage_matrix (np.array) – Linkage matrix generated from EvaluateBatchEffects.similarity_matrix (using SciPy.cluster.hierarchy.linkage)

  • sample_ids (list or np.array) – Ordered list of sample IDs generated from EvaluateBatchEffects.similarity_matrix

  • n_groups (int) – Desired number of groups

Returns

Return type

Pandas.DataFrame

cytopy.flow.batch_effects.indexed_kde(named_x: tuple, kde_f: callable)¶

Utility function for mapping KDE function across multiple data-sets; returns tuple (key, PDF) so that the resulting PDFs can be sorted after calculation.

Parameters

  • named_x (tuple) – (key, data)

  • kde_f (callable) – Some function for estimating PDF

Returns

(key, PDF)

Return type

tuple

cytopy.flow.batch_effects.jenson_shannon_dist(x: numpy.array, y: numpy.array)¶

Wrapper for scipy.spatial.distance.jensenshannon :param x: :type x: Numpy.array :param y: :type y: Numpy.array

Returns

Jenson Shannon Distance

Return type

float

cytopy.flow.batch_effects.kl_distance(x, y)¶

Wrapper for scipy.stats.entropy :param x: :type x: Numpy.array :param y: :type y: Numpy.array

Returns

Kullback–Leibler divergence

Return type

float
